info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 12:06AM EST until December 20 at 1:24AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Raleigh NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River Near Clayton affecting Johnston County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River near Clayton. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Minor overflow occurs on both banks. Water reaches the edge of the Neuse River Greenway trail. At 10.0 feet, Upstream of the gage site, the Neuse River Greenway at Covered Bridge Road begins to flood. At 13.0 feet, Flooding will close the Neuse River Greenway trail. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM EST Sunday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue to rise to a crest of 12.7 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/hydrograph.php?gage=clyn7 && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Fri Neuse River Clayton 9.0 7.9 Sun 11 pm ES 11.6 6.5 3.7 2.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In addition, caution is urged when walking near riverbanks and along Greenways. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1215 PM EST.
